mimic.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to copy the way someone speaks or behaves, especially in order to make people laugh
mimic.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He could mimic all the teachers’ accents.
mimic.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to behave or operate in exactly the same way as something or someone else
mimic.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Europe should not try to mimic Japan: we have to find our own path to successful modernisation.
The drug mimics the action of the body’s own chemicals.
mimic.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if an animal mimics something, it looks or sounds very like it
mimic.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: a fly whose size and colour exactly mimics that of the wasp
mimic.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a person or animal that is good at copying the movements, sound, or appearance of someone or something else
